503.description: The Health Check is not successful

get.description: Returns the Google OAuth URL for authentication.
Handles the OAuth redirect and processes the authentication callback.

post.description: Creates a new customer account in Google Ads.
post.summary: Create a new Google Ads customer account

post.description: Creates a new conversion action for tracking conversions.

get.description: Retrieves a list of accessible Google Ads customer accounts.
Retrieves a list of conversion actions for a customer.

post.description: Retrieves a conversion action by its name or ID for a customer.
post.summary: Get conversion action by name or ID

post.description: Retrieves a campaign by its name or ID for a customer.
post.summary: Get campaign by name or ID

post.description: Creates a new campaign budget in Google Ads.
Creates a new Target ROAS bidding strategy for campaigns.
Retrieves a bidding strategy by its name or ID for a customer.
post.summary: Get bidding strategy by name or ID

post.description: Creates a new search campaign in Google Ads.
Creates a new ad group within a campaign.
Retrieves a adGroup by its name or ID for a customer.
post.summary: Get adGroup by name or ID

post.description: Creates a new ad within an ad group.
Generates keyword ideas for a campaign or ad group.
Adds keywords to an existing ad group.
Adds geo targeting options to a campaign.
Updates the status of a campaign (e.g., ENABLED, PAUSED).

get.description: Used by Lambda functions to get the primary Facebook ad account for campaign creation. Requires API key authentication.

404.description: User has no ready ad account for campaigns

get.summary: Get user's primary ad account for campaign creation

post.description: Creates the main Facebook campaign structure. This is step 1 of the campaign creation process.

400.description: Invalid campaign data or user ad account not ready

post.description: Creates a single Ad Set for the campaign, using the allocated budget and targeting from campaign data. This is step 2.

400.description: Bad request (e.g., campaign not initialized, invalid data)

404.description: Facebook campaign tracking document not found

post.description: Collects all assets (images, text, etc.) from the campaign and creates a single dynamic/flexible creative asset on Facebook. This is step 3.
post.summary: Create a single Flexible Ad Creative

post.description: Creates individual ads linking creatives to ad sets. This is step 4 of the campaign creation process.
Submits the campaign for Facebook review and activates it. This is the final step.

get.description: Returns the current step and status of the campaign creation process. Useful for polling and orchestration.

post.description: If a step in the creation process fails, this endpoint allows the orchestrator (Lambda) to retry it.

400.description: The step is not in a retryable state or the retry limit was exceeded.

post.summary: Retry a failed campaign creation step

get.description: Redirects user to Facebook OAuth consent page to authorize Amplify access to their ad accounts and pages.

200.description: Redirect to Facebook OAuth consent page

get.description: Processes the OAuth callback from Facebook, exchanges code for tokens, and stores user's ad accounts and pages.

400.description: Invalid callback parameters or state token

get.description: Retrieves all Facebook ad accounts connected to the user with their integration status, permissions, and capabilities.

delete.description: Removes a Facebook ad account from the user's connected accounts. Cannot remove primary account.

get.description: Retrieves all Instagram business accounts connected to the user Facebook pages.

post.description: Sets an Instagram account as primary for campaign creation.

get.description: Retrieves the user's primary Instagram account.
Checks if user has Instagram Business accounts connected to their Facebook pages.
Provides instructions for connecting Instagram Business accounts to Facebook pages for advertising and integration.

post.description: Sets an ad account as primary and requests system user permissions for campaign management. This enables Amplify to create campaigns on the user's behalf.

200.description: Primary ad account selected and system user permissions requested

400.description: Invalid ad account ID or system user assignment failed

401.description: User not authenticated or invalid Facebook permissions

403.description: Ad account not found or access denied

get.description: Retrieves the user's primary ad account with full integration status, permissions, and campaign readiness information.

500.description: Failed to get primary ad account

get.description: Checks the health and expiration status of the user's Facebook access token. Provides re-authentication URL if token needs renewal.

post.description: Syncs user's ad accounts from Facebook API, detects new accounts, updates existing ones, and checks system user permissions for all accounts.

401.description: User not authenticated or Facebook token expired

description.example: High-quality wireless headphones with noise cancellation

userId.description: User ID who created the campaign

businessId.description: Business ID this campaign belongs to

campaignData.description: Campaign data from Amplify-Manager via Lambda

step.description: The step that failed and needs to be retried.

adAccountId.description: Facebook Ad Account ID to set as primary

message.example: Primary ad account set and ready for campaigns
Token is healthy and valid for 45 more days
Found 1 new ad account and updated 2 existing accounts
